page.title: 12Ramblers Walk past W. Ashby.
page.content: From the Humber bridge,through Lincolnshire, to Rutland Water reservoir at Oakham in Leicestershire is a long distance footpath known as The Viking Way.Lincs C.C. established this walk in close co-operation with Humberside & Leicestershire C.C,and the Ramblers Assoc. The name of the path,originally suggested by the Ram- blers Assoc. is a recognition of the influence of Danelaw on the eastern counties of England, although much of the Viking Way follows even more ancient routes. The Viking Way cuts through a corner of our Domesday block From Fulletby the path is largely down hill past Grange Farm,crossing sand stone clay and chalky glacial soils towards the Waring Valley and on to Horncastle.
